project.name: client-service
project.description: 💼 Challenge Title: "Microbank: A Full-Stack Microservice Banking Platform" 🧩 Overview: Build a simple banking system with 2 core services: Client Service (handles registration, authentication, profile, blacklist) Banking Service (handles deposits, withdrawals, and balance tracking) There should be a web front-end for both: A client-facing app for banking actions An admin interface for managing clients 🔧 Requirements ✅ Functional Requirements Client Service: Register as a client (email, name, password) Login with JWT authentication Fetch current profile Admin can blacklist a client Blacklisted clients cannot transact Banking Service: Allow deposit and withdrawal Track account balance Prevent overdrafts All transactions must be recorded Blacklisted clients cannot access this service 🌐 Frontend Client App: Register / login page Dashboard showing balance and transaction history Deposit / withdraw interface Error if blacklisted Admin Panel: List of clients Blacklist toggle 🧱 Tech Stack Suggestions (But not required) Layer Suggested Stack Frontend Next.js / React + Tailwind CSS API Gateway Nginx or API Gateway pattern (optional) Auth JWT (shared secret or OAuth2) Client Service Java Spring boot Banking Service Java Spring boot Docker For service containerization 🔐 Security Considerations Only authenticated users can transact Only admins can blacklist JWT should be validated across services Rate-limit sensitive endpoints 🧪 Bonus Objectives ✅ Implement basic unit + integration tests ✅ Add a service-to-service authentication layer ✅ Use a message queue for asynchronous blacklisting enforcement ✅ Docker Compose to spin up both services ✅ Swagger documentation for APIs 🎯 Deliverables Frontend code in /client Client Service in /services/client-service Banking Service in /services/banking-service README with setup, assumptions, and API docs Optional: Postman Collection or Swagger/OpenAPI spec ⏰ Time Limit Estimated time: 3 days. 🔍 Evaluation Criteria 🧠 Correctness and adherence to requirements 📐 Code structure, clarity, and separation of concerns 🔒 Authentication & security implementation 🔁 Handling of edge cases (e.g., blacklisted users, overdrafts) 🧪 Tests if provided 📄 Documentation and setup ease Send the repo link for code review as well as a link to the deployed application
